entries.Name: Alchemist's Supplies
entries.Description: Alchemist’s supplies enable a character to produce useful concoctions, such as acid or alchemist’s fire.
entries.Components: Alchemist’s supplies include two glass beakers, a metal frame to hold a beaker in place over an open flame, a glass stirring rod, a small mortar and pestle, and a pouch of common alchemical ingredients, including salt, powdered iron, and purified water.

Skills.Investigation: When you inspect an area for clues, utilizing Alchemist’s supplies allows you to glean additional insight into any chemicals or other substances that might have been used in the area.

Alchemical Crafting: A character can spend money to collect raw materials, which weigh 1 pound for every 5 gp spent. Each point of raw materials allows you to make one item, and you can only make one item per day.

Some items that can be crafted include:
  • A Vial of Acid, which can be thrown onto a target. The target must make a Reflex Saving Throw. On a failure, the target takes 2d6 acid damage
  • Alchemist's Fire, a fluid that ignites upon contact with the air. A flask of alchemist’s fire can be thrown onto a target within 20 ft. The target must make a reflex check. On a failure, the target takes 1d4 fire damage each round, including the round it was hit, until it uses an action and passes the reflex check.
  • A Vial of Antitoxin, which allows the consumer to gain advantage on checks against poison for 1 hour.
  • A Flask of Oil, which can be used as fuel in a lantern. In combat, this flask can be thrown on the ground as an action, covering 1 square. If lit, it burns for 2 rounds and any character that starts their turn in the square or passes through the square while the oil is list takes 5 fire damage.
  • A Bottle of Perfume, which allows adventurers to hide their horrid stink temporarily
  • A Bar of Soap, which allows adventurers to remove their stink

entries.Name: Brewer's Supplies
entries.Description: Brewing is the art of producing beer. Not only does beer serve as an alcoholic beverage, but the process of brewing purifies water. Crafting beer takes weeks of fermentation, but only a few hours of work.
entries.Components: Brewer’s supplies include a large glass jug, a quantity of hops, a siphon, and several feet of tubing.

Skills.Medicine: This tool grants additional insight when you treat anyone suffering from alcohol poisoning or when you can use alcohol to dull pain.
Skills.Persuasion: A stiff drink can help soften the hardest heart. Using brewer’s supplies can help you ply someone with drink, giving them just enough alcohol to mellow their mood.

Potable Water: Your knowledge of brewing enables you to purify water that would otherwise be undrinkable. As part of a rest, you can purify up to 6 gallons of water, or 1 gallon as part of a rest.

entries.Name: Calligrapher's Supplies
entries.Description: Calligraphy treats writing as a delicate, beautiful art. Calligraphers produce text that is pleasing to the eye, using a style that is difficult to forge. Their supplies also give them some ability to examine scripts and determine if they are legitimate, since a calligrapher’s training involves long hours of studying writing and attempting to replicate its style and design.
entries.Components: Calligrapher’s supplies include ink, a dozen sheets of parchment, and three quills.

Skills.Arcana: Although calligraphy is of little help in deciphering the content of magical writings, these supplies can aid in identifying who wrote a script of a magical nature.
Skills.History: This tool can augment the benefit of successful checks made to analyze or investigate ancient writings, scrolls, or other texts, including runes etched in stone or messages in frescoes or other displays.

Decipher Treasure Map: This tool grants you expertise in examining maps. You can make an Investigation check to determine a map’s age, whether a map includes any hidden messages, or similar facts.

entries.Name: Carpenter's Tools
entries.Description: Skill at carpentry enables a character to construct wooden structures. A carpenter can build a house, a shack, a wooden cabinet, or similar items.
entries.Components: Carpenter’s tools include a saw, a hammer, nails, a hatchet, a square, a ruler, an adze, a plane, and a chisel.

Skills.History: This tool aids you in identifying the use and the origin of wooden buildings and other large wooden objects.
Skills.Investigation: You gain additional insight when inspecting areas within wooden structures, because you know tricks of construction that can conceal areas from discovery.
Skills.Perception: You can spot irregularities in wooden walls or floors, making it easier to find trap doors and secret passages.
Skills.Stealth: You can quickly assess the weak spots in a wooden floor, making it easier to avoid the places that creak and groan when they’re stepped on.

Fortify: With 1 minute of work and raw materials, you can make a door or window harder to force open. Increase the DC needed to open it by 5.
Temporary Shelter: As part of a rest, you can construct a lean-to or a similar shelter to keep your group dry and in the shade for the duration of the rest. Because it was fashioned quickly from whatever wood was available, the shelter collapses 1d3 days after being assembled.

entries.Name: Cartographer's Tools
entries.Description: Using cartographer’s tools, you can create accurate maps to make travel easier for yourself and those who come after you. These maps can range from large-scale depictions of mountain ranges to diagrams that show the layout of a dungeon level.
entries.Components: Cartographer’s tools consist of a quill, ink, parchment, a pair of compasses, calipers, and a ruler.

Skills.Arcana: You can use your knowledge of maps and locations to unearth more detailed information when you use these skills. For instance, you might spot hidden messages in a map, identify when the map was made to determine if geographical features have changed since then, and so forth.
Skills.Nature: Your familiarity with physical geography makes it easier for you to answer questions or solve issues relating to the terrain around you.
Skills.Survival: Your understanding of geography makes it easier to find paths to civilization, to predict areas where villages or towns might be found, and to avoid becoming lost. You have studied so many maps that common patterns, such as how trade routes evolve and where settlements arise in relation to geographic locations, are familiar to you.

Craft a Map: While traveling, you can draw a map as you go in addition to engaging in other activity.

entries.Name: Climber's Kit
entries.Description: A climber’s kit is a much needed item for any adventure that wishes to traverse rugged terrain.
entries.Components: A climber’s kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, 25 ft of rope, and a harness.

Skills.Investigation: Your usage of a Climber’s Kit gives you unique insight into rappelling down and climbing up a wall. It is easier for you to determine where you should attempt to rappel or climb and to determine if a wall has seen recent activity from those with a Climber’s Kit.
Skills.Athletics: Your skill with a Climber’s Kit allows you to attempt public climbing feats more easily. For instance, you could enter a climbing contest and have a leg up on your competition.

Anchor: As an action, you can use your Climber’s Kit to anchor youself. While anchored, you cannot fall or move more than 25 ft from your anchor point. If you are currently falling, you cannot use this action.

entries.Name: Cobbler's Tools
entries.Description: Although the cobbler’s trade might seem too humble for an adventurer, a good pair of boots will see a character across rugged wilderness and through deadly dungeons.
entries.Components: Cobbler’s tools consist of a hammer, an awl, a knife, a shoe stand, a cutter, spare leather, and thread.

Skills.Arcana: Your knowledge of shoes aids you in identifying the magical properties of enchanted boots or the history of such items.
Skills.Investigation: Footwear holds a surprising number of secrets. You can learn where someone has recently visited by examining the wear and the dirt that has accumulated on their shoes. Your experience in repairing shoes makes it easier for you to identify where damage might come from.

Maintain Shoes: As part of a rest, you can repair your companions’ shoes. For the next 24 hours, up to six creatures of your choice who wear shoes you worked on can travel up to 10 hours a day without making saving throws to avoid exhaustion.
Craft Hidden Compartment: With 8 hours of work, you can add a hidden compartment to a pair of shoes. The compartment can hold an object up to 3 inches long and 1 inch wide and deep. An Investigation or Cobbler’s Tool check is needed to discover this compartment if you don’t know it exists

entries.Name: Cook's Utensils
entries.Description: Adventuring is a hard life. With a cook along on the journey, your meals will be much better than the typical mix of hardtack and dried fruit.
entries.Components: Cook’s utensils include a metal pot, knives, forks, a stirring spoon, and a ladle.

Skills.History: Your knowledge of cooking techniques allows you to assess the social patterns involved in a culture’s eating habits.
Skills.Medicine: When administering treatment, you can transform medicine that is bitter or sour into a pleasing concoction.
Skills.Survival: When foraging for food, you can make do with ingredients you scavenge that others would be unable to transform into nourishing meals.

Prepare Meals: As part of a rest, you can prepare a tasty meal that helps your companions regain their strength. You and up to five creatures of your choice regain extra hit points equal to your Cook’s Utensils modifier, provided you have access to your cook’s utensils and sufficient food. This ability does require a successful passing of “Create a typical meal” or “Create a gourmet meal”.

entries.Name: Disguise Kit
entries.Description: The perfect tool for anyone who wants to engage in trickery, a disguise kit enables its owner to adopt a false identity.
entries.Components: A disguise kit includes cosmetics, hair dye, small props, and a few pieces of clothing.

Skills.Deception: In certain cases, a disguise can improve your ability to weave convincing lies.
Skills.Intimidation: The right disguise can make you look more fearsome, whether you want to scare someone away by posing as a plague victim or intimidate a gang of thugs by taking the appearance of a bully.
Skills.Performance: A cunning disguise can enhance an audience’s enjoyment of a performance, provided the disguise is properly designed to evoke the desired reaction.
Skills.Persuasion: Folk tend to trust a person in uniform. If you disguise yourself as an authority figure, your efforts to persuade others are often more effective.

Create Disguise: As part of a rest, you can create a disguise. It takes you 1 minute to don such a disguise once you have created it. You can carry only one such disguise on you at a time without drawing undue attention, unless you have a bag of holding or a similar method to keep them hidden. Each disguise weighs 1 pound.
At other times, it takes 10 minutes to craft a disguise that involves moderate changes to your appearance, and 30 minutes for one that requires more extensive changes.

entries.Name: Fisher's Equipment
entries.Description: Where there is running water, there generally is fish. For adventurers that spend much of their time in the while, Fisher’s Equipment is a must have to provide a steady supply of food.
entries.Components: Fishing Equipment includes a pole, a line, a hook, and either a lure or some bait.

Skills.Insight: Your knowledge of fishing makes it easier for you to determine if a character is telling the truth when talking about anything related to fishing.

Fishing: As part of a rest, you can attempt to go fishing. For every multiple of 5 you roll, you are able to catch enough fish to feed that amount of people for one day.

entries.Name: Forgery Kit
entries.Description: A forgery kit is designed to duplicate documents and to make it easier to copy a person’s seal or signature. This small box contains a variety of papers and parchments, pens and inks, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and other supplies necessary to create convincing forgeries of physical documents.
entries.Components: A forgery kit includes several different types of ink, a variety of parchments and papers, several quills, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and small tools to sculpt melted wax to mimic a seal.

Skills.Arcana: A forgery kit can be used in conjunction with the Arcana skill to determine if a magic item is real or fake.
Skills.Deception: A well-crafted forgery, such as papers proclaiming you to be a noble or a writ that grants you safe passage, can lend credence to a lie.
Skills.History: A forgery kit combined with your knowledge of history improves your ability to create fake historical documents or to tell if an old document is authentic.
Skills.Investigation: When you examine objects, a forgery kit is useful for determining how an object was made and whether it is genuine.

Other Tools: Knowledge of other tools makes your forgeries that much more believable. For example, you could combine your skill with a forgery kit and your skill with cartographer’s tools to make a fake map. When making the forgery check, you would add the average of the two tools being used. Upon a roll of natural 20, both tools would have their modifier increased.
Quick Fake: As part of a rest, you can produce a forged document no more than one page in length. As part of a rest, you can produce a document that is up to four pages long. Your Intelligence check using a forgery kit determines the DC for someone else’s Intelligence (Investigation) check to spot the fake.

entries.Name: Glassblower's Tools
entries.Description: Someone who is proficient with glassblower’s tools has not only the ability to shape glass, but also specialized knowledge of the methods used to produce glass objects.
entries.Components: The tools include a blowpipe, a small marver, blocks, and tweezers. You need a source of heat to work glass.

Skills.Arcana: Your knowledge of glassmaking techniques aids you when you examine glass objects, such as potion bottles or glass items found in a treasure hoard. For instance, you can study how a glass potion bottle has been changed by its contents to help determine a potion’s effects. (A potion might leave behind a residue, deform the glass, or stain it.)
Skills.Investigation: When you study an area, your knowledge can aid you if the clues include broken glass or glass objects.

Identify Weakness: With 1 minute of study, you can identify the weak points in a glass object. Any damage dealt to the object by striking a weak spot is doubled.

entries.Name: Jeweler's Tools
entries.Description: Training with jeweler’s tools includes the basic techniques needed to beautify gems. It also gives you expertise in identifying precious stones.
entries.Components: Jeweler’s tools consist of a small saw and hammer, files, pliers, and tweezers.

Skills.Arcana: Jeweler’s tools grants you knowledge about the reputed mystical uses of gems. This insight proves handy when you make Arcana checks related to gems or gem-encrusted items.
Skills.Investigation: When you inspect jeweled objects, jeweler’s tools aids you in picking out clues they might hold.

Identify Gems: You can identify gems and determine their value at a glance.

entries.Name: Healer's Kit
entries.Description: Everyone gets hurt, and every adventurer gets hurt more than the average person.
entries.Components: This kit is a leather pouch containing enough bandages, salves, and splints for 10 usages of healing.

Skills.Medicine: Your knowledge of healing makes it easier for you to determine the best way to heal a character.

Stabilize: As an action, you can stabilize a creature (no roll needed).
Healing: Once per hour, as an action, you can heal a character. The character heals 2d10 + your Healer’s Kit modifier. If the entire hour is spent healing, the character regains 20 + your Healer’s Kit modifier.

entries.Name: Herbalism Kit
entries.Description: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Using an herbalism kit allows you to identify plants and safely collect their useful elements.
entries.Components: An herbalism kit includes pouches to store herbs, clippers and leather gloves for collecting plants, a mortar and pestle, and several glass jars.

Skills.Arcana: Your knowledge of the nature and uses of herbs can add insight to your magical studies that deal with plants and your attempts to identify potions.
Skills.Investigation: When you inspect an area overgrown with plants, an herbalism kit can help you pick out details and clues that others might miss.
Skills.Medicine: Your mastery of herbalism improves your ability to treat illnesses and wounds by augmenting your methods of care with medicinal plants. Some plants have the ability to remove specific conditions.
Skills.Nature: When you travel in the wild, your skill in herbalism makes it easier to identify plants and spot sources of food that others might overlook.

Identify Plants: You can identify most plants with a quick inspection of their appearance and smell.

entries.Name: Leatherworker's Tools
entries.Description: Knowledge of leatherworking extends to lore concerning animal hides and their properties. It also confers knowledge of leather armor and similar goods.
entries.Components: Leatherworker’s tools include a knife, a small mallet, an edger, a hole punch, thread, and leather scraps.

Skills.Arcana: Your expertise in working with leather grants you added insight when you inspect magic items crafted from leather, such as boots and some cloaks.
Skills.Investigation: You gain added insight when studying leather items or clues related to them, as you draw on your knowledge of leather to pick out details that others would overlook.

Identify Hides: When looking at a hide or a leather item, you can determine the source of the leather and any special techniques used to treat it. For example, you can spot the difference between leather crafted using dwarven methods and leather crafted using halfling methods.

entries.Name: Mason's Tools
entries.Description: Mason’s tools allow you to craft stone structures, including walls and buildings crafted from brick.
entries.Components: Mason’s tools consist of a trowel, a hammer, a chisel, brushes, and a square.

Skills.History: Your expertise aids you in identifying a stone building’s date of construction and purpose, along with insight into who might have built it.
Skills.Investigation: You gain additional insight when inspecting areas within stone structures.
Skills.Perception: You can spot irregularities in stone walls or floors, making it easier to find trap doors and secret passages.

Demolition: Your knowledge of masonry allows you to spot weak points in brick walls. You deal double damage to such structures with your weapon attacks.

entries.Name: Navigator's Tools
entries.Description: Navigator’s tools helps you determine a true course based on observing the stars. It also grants you insight into charts and maps while developing your sense of direction. This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea.
entries.Components: Navigator’s tools include a sextant, a compass, calipers, a ruler, parchment, ink, and a quill.

Skills.Survival: Knowledge of navigator’s tools helps you avoid becoming lost and also grants you insight into the most likely location for roads and settlements.

Sighting: By taking careful measurements, you can determine your position on a nautical chart and the time of day.

entries.Name: Painter's Supplies
entries.Description: Painter’s supplies represents your ability to paint and draw. You also acquire an understanding of art history, which can aid you in examining works of art.
entries.Components: Painter’s supplies include an easel, canvas, paints, brushes, charcoal sticks, and a palette.

Skills.Arcana: Your expertise aids you in uncovering lore of any sort that is attached to a work of art, such as the magical properties of a painting or the origins of a strange mural found in a dungeon.
Skills.Investigation: When you inspect a painting or a similar work of visual art, your knowledge of the practices behind creating it can grant you additional insight.

Painting and Drawing: As part of a rest, you can produce a simple work of art. Although your work might lack precision, you can capture an image or a scene, or make a quick copy of a piece of art you saw.

entries.Name: Poisoner's Kit
entries.Description: A poisoner’s kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. It is a favored resource for thieves, assassins, and others who engage in skulduggery. It allows you to apply poisons and create them from various materials. Your knowledge of poisons also helps you treat them.
entries.Components: A poisoner’s kit includes glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod.

Skills.History: Your training with poisons can help you when you try to recall facts about infamous poisonings.
Skills.Investigation: Your knowledge of poisons has taught you to handle those substances carefully, giving you an edge when you inspect poisoned objects or try to extract clues from events that involve poison
Skills.Medicine: When you treat the victim of a poison, your knowledge grants you added insight into how to provide the best care to your patient.
Skills.Nature: Working with poisons enables you to acquire lore about which plants and animals are poisonous.

Handle Poison: Using a Poisoner’s kit allows you to handle and apply a poison without risk of exposing yourself to its effects.

entries.Name: Potter's Tools
entries.Description: Potter’s tools are used to create a variety of ceramic objects, most typically pots and similar vessels.
entries.Components: Potter’s tools include potter’s needles, ribs, scrapers, a knife, and calipers.

Skills.History: Your expertise aids you in identifying ceramic objects, including when they were created and their likely place or culture of origin.
Skills.Investigation: You gain additional insight when inspecting ceramics, uncovering clues others would overlook by spotting minor irregularities.

Reconstruction: By examining pottery shards, you can determine an object’s original, intact form and its likely purpose.

entries.Name: Smith's Tools
entries.Description: Smith’s tools allow you to work metal, heating it to alter its shape, repair damage, or work raw ingots into useful items.
entries.Components: Smith’s tools include hammers, tongs, charcoal, rags, and a whetstone.

Skills.Arcana: Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining metal objects, such as weapons.
Skills.Investigation: You can spot clues and make deductions that others might overlook when an investigation involves armor, weapons, or other metalwork.

Repair: With access to your tools and an open flame hot enough to make metal pliable, you can restore 10 hit points to a damaged metal object for each hour of work.

entries.Name: Thieves' Tools
entries.Description: Perhaps the most common tools used by adventurers, thieves’ tools are designed for picking locks and foiling traps. This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers.
entries.Components: Thieves’ tools include a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers.

Skills.History: Your knowledge of traps grants you insight when answering questions about locations that are renowned for their traps.
Skills.Investigation: You gain additional insight when looking for traps, because you have learned a variety of common signs that betray their presence.

Set a Trap: Just as you can disable traps, you can also set them. As part of a rest, you can create a trap using items you have on hand. The total of your check becomes the DC for someone else’s attempt to discover or disable the trap. The trap deals damage appropriate to the materials used in crafting it (such as poison or a weapon) or damage equal to half the total of your check, whichever the DM deems appropriate.

entries.Name: Tinker's Tools
entries.Description: A set of tinker’s tools is designed to enable you to repair many mundane objects. Though you can’t manufacture much with tinker’s tools, you can mend torn clothes, sharpen a worn sword, and patch a tattered suit of chain mail.
entries.Components: Tinker’s tools include a variety of hand tools, thread, needles, a whetstone, scraps of cloth and leather, and a small pot of glue.

Skills.History: You can determine the age and origin of objects, even if you have only a few pieces remaining from the original.
Skills.Investigation: When you inspect a damaged object, you gain knowledge of how it was damaged and how long ago.

Repair: You can restore 10 hit points to a damaged object for each hour of work. For any object, you need access to the raw materials required to repair it. For metal objects, you need access to an open flame hot enough to make the metal pliable.

entries.Name: Weaver's Tools
entries.Description: Weaver’s tools allow you to create cloth and tailor it into articles of clothing.
entries.Components: Weaver’s tools include thread, needles, and scraps of cloth. You know how to work a loom, but such equipment is too large to transport.

Skills.Arcana: Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining cloth objects, including cloaks and robes.
Skills.Investigation: Using your knowledge of the process of creating cloth objects, you can spot clues and make deductions that others would overlook when you examine tapestries, upholstery, clothing, and other woven items.

Repair: As part of a rest, you can repair a single damaged cloth object.
Craft Clothing: Assuming you have access to sufficient cloth and thread, you can create an outfit for a creature as part of a rest.

entries.Name: Woodcarver's Tools
entries.Description: Woodcarver’s tools allow you to craft intricate objects from wood, such as wooden tokens or arrows.
entries.Components: Woodcarver’s tools consist of a knife, a gouge, and a small saw.

Skills.Arcana: Your expertise lends you additional insight when you examine wooden objects, such as figurines or arrows.
Skills.Nature: Your knowledge of wooden objects gives you some added insight when you examine trees.

Repair: As part of a rest, you can repair a single damaged wooden object.
Craft Arrows: As part of a rest, you can craft up to twenty. You must have enough wood on hand to produce them.
